phrase: Any sufficiently advanced technology is equivalent to magic.
author: Sir Arthur C. Clarke.

phrase: What drives and pulls the world forward is not machines but ideas.
author: Víctor Hugo

phrase: As long as there is someone who believes in an idea, the idea lives on.
author: José Ortega Y Gasset

phrase: If you've built castles in the air, it's not lost work, that's where they belong. Now build the foundations under them.
author: Henry David Thoreau

phrase: Learn the rules like a pro so you can break them like an artist.
author: Pablo Picasso.

phrase: Others have seen it for what it is and asked.... why? I have seen what it could be and asked .... why not?.
author: Pablo Picasso.

phrase: Make visible that which, without your vision, would never have been seen.
author: Robert Bresson.

phrase: There must be chaos in yourself for you to give birth to a dancing star.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche.

phrase: I force myself to contradict myself to avoid conforming to my own taste.
author: Marcel Duchamp.

phrase: The road to creativity passes very close to the madhouse and often stops or ends there.
author: Ernest Becker.

phrase: Controlling complexity is the essence of programming.
author: Brian Kernigan.

phrase: First solve the problem. Then, write the code.
author: John Johnson.

phrase: Making mistakes is human, but to really mess things up you need a computer.
author: Paul Ehrlich.
